title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: We took the four children inour carriage and drove straight to the " GeorgeInn," where we had the same rooms that we hadlast time. Albert went out immediately to see the prison,and at six we drove together along the LondonRoad (as they rather strangely call it) towardMoncrie^e. The view was perfectly beautiful,and is the finest of Perth and the grand bridgeover the Tay.
